Parameters: String: The name of the setting to retrieve.
Throws: Thrown if a setting by the given name can't be found or the setting value is not a float.
getFloat(android.content.ContentResolver.Description: Convenience function for retrieving a single secure settings value as a float. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings; this function converts the string to a float for you. This version does not take a default value. If the setting has not been set, or the string value is not a number, it throws @B_android#provider#Settings#SettingNotFoundException_E@.
getFloat(android.content.ContentResolver.FullName: public static float getFloat (ContentResolver cr, String name)

Returns: true if the value was set, false on database errors
Parameters: String: The name of the setting to modify.
float: The new value for the setting.
putFloat(android.content.ContentResolver.Description: Convenience function for updating a single settings value as a floating point number. This will either create a new entry in the table if the given name does not exist, or modify the value of the existing row with that name. Note that internally setting values are always stored as strings, so this function converts the given value to a string before storing it.
putFloat(android.content.ContentResolver.FullName: public static boolean putFloat (ContentResolver cr, String name, float value)

ClassDesc: Global system settings, containing preferences that always apply identically to all defined users. Applications can read these but are not allowed to write; like the "Secure" settings, these are for preferences that the user must explicitly modify through the system UI or specialized APIs for those values.
